alert.note: Alert for Coos; Grafton; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 13 at 8:02PM EDT until July 13 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Coos County in northern New Hampshire... Northwestern Sullivan County in central New Hampshire... Grafton County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 802 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 11 miles west of Littleton to 9 miles southwest of Lebanon, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Berlin, Littleton, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Plymouth, Hanover, Haverhill, Enfield, Canaan, Holderness, Franconia, Groton, Errol, Woodstock, Piermont, Stratford, Carroll and Grantham. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 48 and 60. Interstate 93 between mile markers 80 and 131. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
